Articles.Content:
There is nothing nice about the curse site and I thankyou for providing an alternative download

Can you provide a link to a list of "reasons the curse site is bad"? That would be more helpful than a claim with no support. This is still on topic as Frizz could use this information, too. I suppose. Off topic would be if people started listing off reasons right here in this thread... which will probably happen anyway despite my white bucket head of justice. Praise the Sun!

Curse is fine, the premium nag is in poor taste and there has been problems in the past with malware infected ads, but that has happened to pretty much every site that runs ads via an third party that might or might not actually check the ads for malware or at all.

Problem is that on the internet once something has been branded as bad that sticks around long after the reasons or supposed reasons it happened in the first place are gone.

MediaFire has ads as well but no one minds because it hasn't been branded as evil (yet).

If you have firefox you can run an add on called noScript. It works extremely well at preventing any script from running in your browser and lets you pick which ones you want to let through. Most of the malicious web adds are run through script and as long as I have had it active I have never had any mallware or viruses.

As said, I am going to try Curse out, give it a fair shake, and see how it goes.
Or you know, use AdBlock.

This is my favorite mod. Thank you so much for making it, and all the hard work you're putting into it. I'm having a lot of fun recreating the NASA program, and the design of the parts is so high quality I use them all the time for mix & match stuff.

One addition that I think would be really rad is adding inflatable flotation systems for when you splash down (or hit land, haha). You know what I'm referring to? With all the other details you are adding, I think this one would have a nice aesthetic touch. Another cool set of parts would be heat shields. Even if they are just there for looks. But integration with Deadly Reentry would be ideal. Thanks again for your awesome mod!

This is my favorite mod. Thank you so much for making it, and all the hard work you're putting into it. I'm having a lot of fun recreating the NASA program, and the design of the parts is so high quality I use them all the time for mix & match stuff.

One addition that I think would be really rad is adding inflatable flotation systems for when you splash down (or hit land, haha). You know what I'm referring to? With all the other details you are adding, I think this one would have a nice aesthetic touch. Another cool set of parts would be heat shields. Even if they are just there for looks. But integration with Deadly Reentry would be ideal. Thanks again for your awesome mod!

The Apollo CM has them, but I'm guessing you mean as a separate part??
The new sounds are fantastic! Did you take some craft files away it seems like there are a lot more more craft files in the older release?
Less than it originally had but the same as the last version.

Less than it originally had but the same as the last version.

That's what I mean. Are you gonna bring them back?

Okay, fresh field test report with the latest beta, 4.70...

THe new Saturn V clamps do not line up right in the VAB. They are all over the place: sideways, backwards, even upside down at points, depending on what you're putting it on. :/

So I am going to "Try Out" the new curse website. It looks like it has some nice features and if they all work it will be a welcomed change. If your completely appalled by the use of Curse I will post a second download on MediaFire as well.

Curse sight needs approval before its public....

Latest Beta Includes new sounds and launch clamps. No Nova parts yet.

http://www./download/rp72zsu08v174of/FASA4.70.zip

It is your choice to use curse or not. However, What about the community efforts to host addons?

Hey guys, I think I'm insane...

Now before you ask yourself if your drunk or seeing double, let me answer you. No. I DID strap TWO Saturn V rockets to the side of a Atlas rocket with an Agena.

This was a test to see if I can get a fully loaded interstellar craft into orbit then into deep space...

... The answer is yes!

I successfully launched the Atlas into orbit and it left orbit. I took it all the way to Duna and landed the Agena probe(after ditching the Atlas Nuclear transfer stage) on the surface where it is transmitting the data back to the wonderful minds at the KSC. Next mission is manned. Jeb, Bob, and Bill(along with a few others) are training hard to go to Duna while the scientists and builders work on a rocket that will carry crew and lander to Duna and back.

"Good luck and God speed gentlemen."

*Cue Armageddon theme music*

http://imgur.com/a/jy2Yq#0

Edited May 20, 2014 by GoldForest

Im having difficulty uploading large files to curse +100mb, just says problem loading page. Does anyone have any clue as to how I upload large files?

Use mediafire? It's probably good to have a Curse mirror, but it isn't that well liked by the community. I don't know if it takes files of this size at all, but if it doesn't, it wouldn't be that surprising...
The new F1 sound is just gorgeous. Did you sample it from video or something?
frizzank: best bet is to hop on #kspmodders and bug Kaelten. He'll get it sorted for you.

The new F1 sound is just gorgeous. Did you sample it from video or something?

I found a clip from NASA for the space shuttle and edited it to sound more like the F-1, added more bass and shifted the pitch down some.
Could you send me the sound for the Shuttle in an usable form (also with a config)? It'd fit right in for the CSS (you'll get credit, of course). It's an SSME sound, right?
